ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Rate how you feel right now: Fatigue
Notes: 0= No symptoms; 1= Mild symptoms; 2= Moderate symptoms; 3= Severe Symptoms; 4= Very Severe Symptoms

ElementDescription: Rate how you feel right now: Shivering
Notes: 0= No symptoms; 1= Mild symptoms; 2= Moderate symptoms; 3= Severe Symptoms; 4= Very Severe Symptoms

ElementDescription: Rate how you feel right now: Nausea
Notes: 0= No symptoms; 1= Mild symptoms; 2= Moderate symptoms; 3= Severe Symptoms; 4= Very Severe Symptoms

ElementDescription: Rate how you feel right now: Breathing Difficulties
Notes: 0= No symptoms; 1= Mild symptoms; 2= Moderate symptoms; 3= Severe Symptoms; 4= Very Severe Symptoms

ElementDescription: Rate how you feel right now: Headaches
Notes: 0= No symptoms; 1= Mild symptoms; 2= Moderate symptoms; 3= Severe Symptoms; 4= Very Severe Symptoms

ElementDescription: Rate how you feel right now: Muscle Pain
Notes: 0= No symptoms; 1= Mild symptoms; 2= Moderate symptoms; 3= Severe Symptoms; 4= Very Severe Symptoms
0= No pain; 5= Moderate pain; 10= Worst pain

ElementDescription: Choose number that best describes your level of alertness or sleepiness right now
Notes: 1= Feeling active, vital, alert, wide awake; 2= Functioning at a high level but not at peak, able to concentrate; 3= Relaxed, awake, but not fully alert, responsive; 4= A little foggy; 5= Foggy, beginning to lose track, difficulty staying awake; 6= Sleepy, prefer to lie down, woozy; 7= Cannot stay awake, sleep onset appears imminent
